content.heading: Quotation and Citation Elements
paragraphs: HTML provides elements for quotations, abbreviations, and contact information.

content.heading: <blockquote> for Quotations
paragraphs: The <blockquote> element defines a quoted section, often indented:

Here is a quote from WWF's website:

For 60 years, WWF has worked to help people and nature thrive. As the world's leading conservation organization, WWF works in nearly 100 countries.

content.heading: <q> for Short Quotations
paragraphs: The <q> tag marks short quotations with automatic quotation marks:
WWF's goal is to: Build a future where people live in harmony with nature.

content.heading: <abbr> for Abbreviations
paragraphs: The <abbr> tag defines abbreviations or acronyms, with a title attribute for hover text:
The WHO was founded in 1948.

content.heading: <address> for Contact Information
paragraphs: The <address> tag provides contact details, typically in italics with line breaks:

Written by John Doe.
Visit us at:
Example.com
Box 564, Disneyland
USA

content.heading: <cite> for Work Titles
paragraphs: The <cite> tag denotes creative work titles, usually in italics:
The Scream by Edvard Munch. Painted in 1893.

content.heading: <bdo> for Text Direction
paragraphs: The <bdo> tag overrides text direction, e.g., right-to-left:
<bdo dir="rtl">This text will be written from right to left</bdo>
